description: From Middle English aracen, arasen, from Old French arachier, esracier (modern French arracher), from Latin exradicare, eradicare. The prefix a- is perhaps due to Latin ab. See eradicate.

verbs.description: arace (third-person singular simple present araces, present participle aracing, simple past and past participle araced)

entries.meaning: (obsolete, transitive) To tear up by the roots; to draw away.
examples: I had my thought, and mynde araced
